alert.note: Alert for Rockland; Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 2:15PM EST until December 19 at 7:40PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Bronx, Rockland and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows remain elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 212 PM EST, Streams across the advisory area still experiencing minor flooding. Levels across these streams are expected to continue to fall below their banks in the next couple of hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yonkers, New Rochelle, East Tremont, Monsey, Nanuet, Tarrytown, Dobbs Ferry, Suffern, Nyack, Tappan, Riverdale, Co-op City, Scarsdale, Pearl River, Bronxville, Orangeburg, City Island, Upper Nyack, Mount Vernon and Eastchester. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
